title: From The Rest of international & Regional Airports to City or County
intro: While Taoyuan (TPE) is the main gateway, Taiwan has two other key international airports closer to city centers: Taipei Songshan (TSA) and Taichung (RMQ). Additionally, a network of domestic airports connects the main island to the beautiful offshore islands and the scenic East Coast. This guide breaks down how to use them and how to get to the city.

TSA is a unique 'City Center Airport' serving high-end business travelers. Its international routes are highly concentrated on other downtown airports: Tokyo Haneda, Seoul Gimpo, and Shanghai Hongqiao.

ğŸš‡ Metro Connection (Fastest)

The airport is directly connected to the Brown Line (Wenhu Line) at Songshan Airport Station (BR13).

  • Transfer at Nanjing Fuxing (BR11): Switch to Green Line (Ximen, Songshan).
  • Transfer at Zhongxiao Fuxing (BR10): Switch to Blue Line (Taipei Main Station, Xinyi District).

Currently focuses on Cross-strait routes, Hong Kong, Macau, Vietnam, and seasonal charters to Japan/Korea.

ğŸšŒ Transport to City (No MRT at Airport)

Please note: There is currently NO MRT station at the airport. You must take a bus or taxi first.

  • To MRT Green Line: Take Bus 555 to MRT Wenhua High School or Taichung City Hall station.
  • To HSR Station: Take Bus 156 directly to Taichung HSR Station.
  • To City Center: Take Bus 500 or 302.
